devdoc.author: etsvigun <utgarda@gmail.com>, Bertrand Masius <github@catageeks.tk>

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. Required for ERC20 compatibility.

params.owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params.spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

allowance(address,address).return: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Required for ERC20 compatilibity.

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

authorizeOperator(address).details: Authorize an operator for the sender

params.operator: address to be authorized as operator

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.tokenHolder: The address to query the balance of.

balanceOf(address).return: uint256 representing the amount owned by the specified address.

burn(uint256,bytes).details: Burn the amount of tokens from the address msg.sender

params.amount: uint256 amount of tokens to transfer
params.data: bytes extra information provided by the token holder

decimals().return: the number of decimals of the token.

defaultOperators().details: Get the list of default operators as defined by the token contract.

granularity().details: Gets the token's granularity, i.e. the smallest number of tokens (in the basic unit) which may be minted, sent or burned at any time

isOperatorFor(address,address).details: Indicate whether an address is an operator of the tokenHolder address

params.operator: address which may be an operator of tokenHolder
params.tokenHolder: address of a token holder which may have the operator address as an operator.

operatorBurn(address,uint256,bytes,bytes.details: Burn the amount of tokens on behalf of the address from

params.amount: uint256 amount of tokens to transfer
params.data: bytes extra information provided by the token holder
params.operatorData: bytes extra information provided by the operator (if any)

operatorSend(address,address,uint256,byt.details: Send the amount of tokens on behalf of the address from to the address to

params.amount: uint256 amount of tokens to transfer
params.data: bytes information attached to the send, and intended for the recipient (to)
params.operatorData: bytes extra information provided by the operator (if any)

revokeOperator(address).details: Revoke operator rights from one of the default operators

params.operator: address to revoke operator rights from

send(address,uint256,bytes).details: Send the amount of tokens from the address msg.sender to the address to

params.amount: uint256 amount of tokens to transfer
params.data: bytes information attached to the send, and intended for the recipient (to)

totalSupply().details: Total number of tokens in existence

transfer(address,uint256).details: Transfer token to a specified address. Required for ERC20 compatiblity. Note that transferring tokens this way may result in locked tokens (i.e. tokens can be sent to a contract that does not implement the ERC777TokensRecipient interface).

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfer tokens from one address to another. Note that while this function emits an Approval event, this is not required as per the specification, and other compliant implementations may not emit the event. Required for ERC20 compatiblity. Note that transferring tokens this way may result in locked tokens (i.e. tokens can be sent to a contract that does not implement the ERC777TokensRecipient interface).

params.from: address The address which you want to send tokens from
params.to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params.value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

devdoc.title: ERC777 token implementation, with granularity harcoded to 1.
